### California Civil Code §1798.82 (Data Breach Notification)
**Citation:** Cal. Civ. Code §1798.82 (2023)
**Statutory Text:**
> "A person who conducts business in California and owns, licenses, holds, stores, or otherwise possesses personal information about a California resident shall disclose any breach of the security of that personal information to any California resident whose unencrypted personal information was, or is reasonably believed to have been, accessed, acquired, or disclosed as a result of such breach in no later than 30 days after the discovery of the breach. The notice shall be written in plain language and shall include, at a minimum, the following: (1) a description of the categories of personal information involved; (2) the date, to the extent possible, when the breach occurred; (3) contact information for an appropriate person or entity that can provide further details, identity theft protection, and remedial actions."
